meanings.definition: To make (something) appealing or interesting to a wide audience.
meanings.sent1: The teacher tried to popularize the new book by reading it aloud to the class.
meanings.sent2: The company used social media to popularize their latest product launch.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to popularize his disappearing act by adding a funny twist.
meanings.sent4: The artist's unique style popularized her work among art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: The catchy jingle was used to popularize the new cereal brand.

meanings.definition: To make (something) widely known or accepted.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity's endorsement helped popularize the new fashion trend.
meanings.sent2: The documentary aimed to popularize the importance of recycling.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt to popularize his new recipe failed when it turned out too spicy.
meanings.sent4: The viral video popularized the dance move across social media platforms.
meanings.sent5: The campaign was successful in popularizing the charity's mission.
